073/**
074 *  Library of utility methods that are useful when dealing with Strings. <br>
075 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
076 *  <code>org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils</code> and modified to match the
077 *  requirements of this project. In particular, these are the methods
078 *  <ul>
079 *  <li>{@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int) abbreviate()}</li>
080 *  <li>{@link #capitalize(CharSequence) capitalize()}</li>
081 *  <li>{@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence) escapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
082 *  <li>{@link #isEmpty(CharSequence) isEmpty()}</li>
083 *  <li>{@link #isNotEmpty(CharSequence) isNotEmpty()}</li>
084 *  <li>{@link #repeat(CharSequence, int) repeat()}</li>
085 *  <li>{@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence) unescapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
086 *  </ul>
087 *
088 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
089 *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $
090 *  @since 0.0.3
091 *
092 *  @UMLGraph.link
093 */
094@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
095@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $" )
096@UtilityClass
097public final class StringUtils
098{
099        /*---------------*\
100    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
101        \*---------------*/
102    /**
103     *  The clipping mode that is used for the method
104     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
105     *
106     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
107     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $
108     *  @since 0.0.3
109     *
110     *  @UMLGraph.link
111     */
112    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
113    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $" )
114    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
115    public static enum Clipping
116    {
117            /*------------------*\
118        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
119            \*------------------*/
120        /**
121         *  If an input String is already longer than the target length, it
122         *  will be returned unchanged.
123         */
124        CLIPPING_NONE
125        {
126            /**
127             *  {@inheritDoc}
128             */
129            @Override
130            protected final String clip( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return input.toString(); }
131        },
132
133        /**
134         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
135         *  just shortened to that length.
136         */
137        CLIPPING_CUT
138        {
139            /**
140             *  {@inheritDoc}
141             */
142            @Override
143            protected final String clip( final CharSequence input, final int length )
144            {
145                final var retValue = (
146                    input.length() > length ? input.subSequence( 0, length ) :
147                    input).toString();
148
149                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
150                return retValue;
151            }   //  clip()
152        },
153
154        /**
155         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
156         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
157         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}
158         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 4.
159         */
160        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
161        {
162            /**
163             *  {@inheritDoc}
164             */
165            @Override
166            protected final String clip( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return abbreviate( input, length ); }
167        },
168
169        /**
170         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
171         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
172         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviateMiddle(CharSequence, int)}
173         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 5.
174         */
175        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
176        {
177            /**
178             *  {@inheritDoc}
179             */
180            @Override
181            protected final String clip( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return abbreviateMiddle( input, length ); }
182        };
183
184            /*---------*\
185        ====** Methods **======================================================
186            \*---------*/
187        /**
188         *  Clips the given input String.
189         *
190         *  @param  input   The input String.
191         *  @param  length  The target length.
192         *  @return The result String.
193         */
194        protected abstract String clip( final CharSequence input, final int length );
195    }
196    //  enum Clipping
197
198    /**
199     *  The padding mode that is used for the methods
200     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,boolean)}
201     *  and
202     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
203     *
204     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
205     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $
206     *  @since 0.0.5
207     *
208     *  @UMLGraph.link
209     */
210    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
211    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1084 2024-01-03 15:31:20Z tquadrat $" )
212    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
213    public static enum Padding
214    {
215            /*------------------*\
216        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
217            \*------------------*/
218        /**
219         *  The pad characters are distributed evenly at begin and end of the
220         *  string.
221         */
222        PADDING_CENTER
223        {
224            /**
225             *  {@inheritDoc}
226             */
227            @Override
228            protected final String pad( final CharSequence input, final int padSize, final char c )
229            {
230                final var rightSize = padSize / 2;
231                final var leftSize = padSize - rightSize;
232                final var retValue = padding( leftSize, c ) + input.toString() + padding( rightSize, c );
233
234                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
235                return retValue;
236            }   //  pad()
237        },
238
239        /**
240         *  The pad characters are added at the beginning of the string
241         *  (prefixing it).
242         */
243        PADDING_LEFT
244        {
245            /**
246             *  {@inheritDoc}
247             */
248            @Override
249            protected final String pad( final CharSequence input, final int padSize, final char c )
250            {
251                return padding( padSize, c ) + input.toString();
252            }   //  pad()
253        },
254
255        /**
256         *  The pad characters are added the end of the string (as a suffix).
257         */
258        PADDING_RIGHT
259        {
260            /**
261             *  {@inheritDoc}
262             */
263            @Override
264            protected final String pad( final CharSequence input, final int padSize, final char c )
265            {
266                return input.toString() + padding( padSize, c );
267            }   //  pad()
268        };
269
270            /*---------*\
271        ====** Methods **======================================================
272            \*---------*/
273        /**
274         *  Pads the given input String.
275         *
276         *  @param  input   The input String.
277         *  @param  padSize The pad size.
278         *  @param  c   The pad character.
279         *  @return The result String.
280         */
281        protected abstract String pad( final CharSequence input, final int padSize, final char c );
282
283        /**
284         *  <p>{@summary Returns padding using the specified pad character repeated to the
285          *  given length.}</p>
286         *  <br><code>
287         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;0,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
288         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;3,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"eee"<br>
289         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;-2,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;IndexOutOfBoundsException<br>
290         *  </code>
291         *
292         *  @param  repeat  Number of times to repeat {@code padChar}; must be
293         *      0 or greater.
294         *  @param  padChar Character to repeat.
295         *  @return String with repeated {@code padChar} character, or the
296         *      empty String if {@code repeat} is 0.
297         *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@code repeat} is less than 0.
298         *
299         *  @see StringUtils#repeat(int,int)
300         */
301        private static String padding( final int repeat, final char padChar ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
302        {
303            if( repeat < 0 ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( MSG_PadNegative.formatted( repeat ) );
304
305            final var retValue = Character.toString( padChar ).repeat( repeat ).intern();
306
307            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
308            return retValue;
309        }   //  padding()
310    }
311    //  enum Padding
312
313        /*-----------*\
314    ====** Constants **========================================================
315        \*-----------*/
316    /**
317     *  <p>{@summary The regular expression for an HTML or XML comment:
318     *  {@value}.}</p>
319     *  <p>This pattern is used by the
320     *  {@link #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}
321     *  method.</p>
322     *
323     *  @since 0.0.5
324     */
325    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
326    public static final String COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN = "<!--.+?-->";
327
328    /**
329     *  The message text indicating that the given value for the abbreviation
330     *  target length is too short.
331     */
332    private static final String MSG_AbbrTooShort = "The minimum abbreviation width is %d";
333
334    /**
335     *  The message indicating that the give size for padding is negative.
336     */
337    private static final String MSG_PadNegative = "Cannot pad a negative amount: %d";
338
339    /**
340     *  The maximum size to which the padding constant(s) can expand: {@value}.
341     *
342     *  @see #repeat(CharSequence,int) repeat() for String
343     *  @see #repeat(char,int) repeat() for char
344     */
345    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
346    private static final int PAD_LIMIT = 8192;
347
348    /**
349     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML tag: {@value}.<br>
350     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
351     *  {@link #stripTags(CharSequence)}
352     *  method.<br>
353     *  <br>As HTML/XML comments may contain a &quot;greater than&quot; sign
354     *  ('&gt;' or '&amp;gt;'), it is necessary to treat comments
355     *  separately.<br>
356     *  <br>Just as a reminder: several sources recommend using the following
357     *  idiom for embedded JavaScript:<pre><code>  &lt;script&gt;
358     *  &lt;!--
359     *  <i>JavaScript code </i>
360     *  --&gt;
361     *  &lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>
362     *
363     *  @since 0.0.5
364     */
365    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
366    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
367    public static final String TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN = "(?:<!--.+?-->)|(?:<[^>]+?>)";
368
369        /*------------------------*\
370    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
371        \*------------------------*/
372    /**
373     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML comment.
374     *
375     *  @see #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)
376     *  @see #COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN
377     */
378    private static final Pattern m_CommentRemovalPattern;
379
380    /**
381     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML tag.
382     *
383     *  @see #stripTags(CharSequence)
384     *  @see #TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN
385     */
386    private static final Pattern m_TagRemovalPattern;
387
388    static
389    {
390        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
391        try
392        {
393            m_CommentRemovalPattern = compile( COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
394            m_TagRemovalPattern = compile( TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
395        }
396        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
397        {
398            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
399        }
400    }
401

403    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
404        \*--------------*/
405    /**
406     *  No instance of this class is allowed.
407     */
408    private StringUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( StringUtils.class ); }
409
410        /*---------*\
411    ====** Methods **==========================================================
412        \*---------*/
413    /**
414     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
415     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
416     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is the time for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
417     *  <br>Specifically:
418     *  <ul>
419     *  <li>If {@code text} is less than {@code maxWidth} characters long,
420     *  return it unchanged.</li>
421     *  <li>Else abbreviate it to <code>(substring( text, 0, max - 1 ) +
422     *  &quot;&hellip;&quot; )</code>.</li>
423     *  <li>If {@code maxWidth} is less than 4, throw an
424     *  {@link ValidationException}.</li>
425     *  <li>In no case it will return a String of length greater than
426     *  {@code maxWidth}.</li>
427     *  </ul>
428     *  Some samples:<br>
429     *  <pre><code>
430     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, * )      = null
431     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 4 )        = ""
432     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abc", 4 ) = "abc"
433     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcd", 4 ) = "abcd;"
434     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 4 ) = "abc&hellip;"
435     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 7 ) = "abcdefg"
436     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 8 ) = "abcdefg"
437     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 3 ) = IllegalArgumentException
438     *  </code></pre>
439     *
440     *  @param  text    The String to abbreviate, can be {@code null}.
441     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
442     *      least 4.
443     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
444     *      already {@code null}.
445     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
446     *      than 4.
447     *
448     *  @since 0.0.5
449     */
450    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
451    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
452    {
453        return abbreviate( text, 0, maxWidth );
454    }   //  abbreviate()
455
456    /**
457     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
458     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
459     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>&hellip;is the time
460     *  for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
461     *  <br>Works like
462     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)},
463     *  but allows to specify a &quot;left edge&quot; offset. Note that this
464     *  left edge is not necessarily going to be the leftmost character in the
465     *  result, or the first character following the ellipses, but it will
466     *  appear somewhere in the result. An offset less than 0 will be treated
467     *  as 0, a value greater than {@code maxWidth} will be ignored.<br>
468     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
469     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
470     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
471     *  <pre>
472     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, *, * )                = null
473     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 0, 4 )                  = ""
474     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", -1, 10 ) = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
475     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 0, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
476     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 1, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
477     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 4, 10 )  = "&hellip;efghijkl&hellip;"
478     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 5, 10 )  = "&hellip;fghijklm&hellip;"
479     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 6, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
480     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 8, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
481     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 10, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
482     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 12, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
483     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 0, 3 )        = IllegalArgumentException
484     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 5, 6 )        = IllegalArgumentException
485     *  </pre>
486     *
487     *  @param  text    The String to process, can be {@code null}.
488     *  @param  offset  The left edge of the source String; this value will not
489     *      be checked.
490     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
491     *      least 4.
492     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
493     *      already {@code null}.
494     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
495     *      than 4.
496     *
497     *  @since 0.0.5
498     */
499    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
500    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int offset, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
501    {
502        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
503
504        String retValue = null;
505        if( nonNull( text ) )
506        {
507            if( maxWidth < 4 ) throw new ValidationException( String.format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 4 ) );
508
509            final var len = text.length();
510            if( len > maxWidth )
511            {
512                var effectiveOffset = min( offset, len);
513                if( (len - effectiveOffset) < (maxWidth - 1))
514                {
515                    effectiveOffset = len - (maxWidth - 1);
516                }
517                if( effectiveOffset <= 1 )
518                {
519                    retValue = text.subSequence( 0, maxWidth - 1 ) + ellipsis;
520                }
521                else
522                {
523                    if( ((effectiveOffset + maxWidth) - 1) < len )
524                    {
525                        retValue = ellipsis + abbreviate( text.subSequence( effectiveOffset, len ), maxWidth - 1 );
526                    }
527                    else
528                    {
529                        retValue = ellipsis + text.subSequence( len - (maxWidth - 1), len );
530                    }
531                }
532            }
533            else
534            {
535                retValue = text.toString();
536            }
537        }
538
539        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
540        return retValue;
541    }   //  abbreviate()
542
543    /**
544     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
545     *  0x2026) in the middle of the returned text. This will turn &quot;<i>Now
546     *  is the time for all good men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is &hellip;
547     *  good men</i>&quot;<br>
548     *  <br>Works like
549     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}.<br>
550     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
551     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
552     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
553     *  <pre>
554     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle(null, *)      = null
555     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("", 5)        = ""
556     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 5) = "ab&hellip;gh"
557     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 7) = "ab&hellip;gh"
558     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 8) = "abcdefgh"
559     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 4) = IllegalArgumentException
560     *  </pre>
561     *
562     *  @param  input   The String to check, may be {@code null}.
563     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
564     *      least 5.
565     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
566     *      already {@code null}.
567     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
568     *      than 5.
569     *
570     *  @since 0.0.5
571     */
572    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
573    public static final String abbreviateMiddle( final CharSequence input, final int maxWidth )
574    {
575        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
576
577        String retValue = null;
578        if( nonNull( input ) )
579        {
580            if( maxWidth < 5 ) throw new ValidationException( String.format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 5 ) );
581
582            final var len = input.length();
583            if( len > maxWidth )
584            {
585                final var suffixLength = (maxWidth - 1) / 2;
586                final var prefixLength = maxWidth - 1 - suffixLength;
587                final var suffixStart = len - suffixLength;
588                retValue = input.subSequence( 0, prefixLength ) + ellipsis + input.subSequence( suffixStart, suffixStart + suffixLength );
589            }
590            else
591            {
592                retValue = input.toString();
593            }
594        }
595
596        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
597        return retValue;
598    }   //  abbreviateMiddle()
599
600    /**
601     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a long string into chunks of the given length.}</p>
602     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
603     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array or a
604     *  collection.</p>
605     *  <p>To array:</p>
606     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
607     *  <p>To collection (here: a
608     *  {@link List}):</p>
609     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
610     *
611     *  @param  input   The string.
612     *  @param  chunk   The chunk size.
613     *  @return The chunks from the string; the last chunk could be shorter
614     *      than the others.
615     *
616     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
617     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
618     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
619     *
620     *  @since 0.0.5
621     */
622    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
623    public static final Stream<String> breakString( final CharSequence input, final int chunk )
624    {
625        if( chunk < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( "Chunk size must not be zero or a negative number: %d".formatted( chunk ) );
626
627        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
628        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" ).length();
629        var pos = 0;
630        while( (pos + chunk) < len )
631        {
632            builder.add( input.subSequence( pos, pos + chunk ).toString() );
633            pos += chunk;
634        }
635        if( pos < len ) builder.add( input.subSequence( pos, len ).toString() );
636
637        final var retValue = builder.build();
638
639        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
640        return retValue;
641    }   //  breakString()
642
643    /**
644     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a text into lines of the given length, but
645     *  different from
646     *  {@link #breakString(CharSequence, int)},
647     *  it will honour whitespace.}</p>
648     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
649     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array, a String, or
650     *  a collection.</p>
651     *  <p>To array:</p>
652     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
653     *  <p>To String:</p>
654     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.joining() )</code></pre>
655     *  <p>To collection (here: a
656     *  {@link List}):</p>
657     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
658     *
659     *  @param  text    The text.
660     *  @param  lineLength  The length of a line.
661     *  @return The lines; if a word is longer than the given line length, a
662     *      line containing only that word can be longer that the given line
663     *      length.
664     *
665     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
666     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
667     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
668     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence)
669     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)
670     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
671     *
672     *  @since 0.0.5
673     */
674    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
675    public static final Stream<String> breakText( final CharSequence text, final int lineLength )
676    {
677        if( lineLength < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( "Line length size must not be zero or a negative number: %d".formatted( lineLength ) );
678
679        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
680
681        for( final var line : splitString( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ), '\n' ) )
682        {
683            if( isEmptyOrBlank( line ) )
684            {
685                builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
686            }
687            else
688            {
689                final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
690                final var chunks = line.split( "\\s" );
691                SplitLoop: for( final var chunk : chunks )
692                {
693                    if( chunk.isEmpty() ) continue SplitLoop;
694                    if( (buffer.length() + 1 + chunk.length()) < lineLength )
695                    {
696                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer) ) buffer.append( ' ' );
697                    }
698                    else
699                    {
700                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) )
701                        {
702                            builder.add( buffer.toString() );
703                            buffer.setLength( 0 );
704                        }
705                    }
706                    buffer.append( chunk );
707                }   //  SplitLoop:
708                if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) ) builder.add( buffer.toString() );
709            }
710        }
711
712        final var retValue = builder.build();
713
714        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
715        return retValue;
716    }   //  breakText()
717
718    /**
719     *  <p>{@summary <i>Capitalises</i> a String, meaning changing the first
720     *  letter to upper case as per
721     *  {@link Character#toUpperCase(char)}.} No other letters are changed.</p>
722     *  <p>A {@code null} input String returns {@code null}.</p>
723     *  <p>Samples:</p>
724     *  <pre><code>  StringUtils.capitalize( null )  == null;
725     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;&quot; )    == &quot;&quot;;
726     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cat&quot; ) == &quot;Cat&quot;;
727     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cAt&quot; ) == &quot;CAt&quot;;</code></pre>
728     *  <p>Use this function to create a getter or setter name from the name of
729     *  the attribute.</p>
730     *  <p>This method does not recognise the
731     *  {@linkplain java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}.
732     *  This means that &quot;istanbul&quot; will become &quot;Istanbul&quot;
733     *  even for the locale {@code tr_TR} (although &quot;&#x130;stanbul&quot;
734     *  would be correct).</p>
735     *
736     *  @param input    The String to capitalise, can be {@code null}.
737     *  @return The capitalised String, or {@code null} if the argument
738     *      was already {@code null}.
739     *
740     *  @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
741     *
742     *  @since 0.0.5
743     */
744    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
745    public static final String capitalize( final CharSequence input )
746    {
747        String retValue = null;
748        if( nonNull( input ) )
749        {
750            @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
751            final var s = input.toString();
752            if( s.isEmpty() )
753            {
754                retValue = s;
755            }
756            else
757            {
758                retValue = (toUpperCase( s.charAt( 0 ) ) + s.substring( 1 )).intern();
759            }
760        }
761
762        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
763        return retValue;
764    }   //  capitalize()
765
766    /**
767     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
768     *  longer than the given maximum length. Use this to check whether a
769     *  String that is provided as an argument to a method is longer than
770     *  expected.
771     *
772     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
773     *      will be thrown. Usually this is the name of the argument to
774     *      validate.
775     *  @param  text    The text to check.
776     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
777     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
778     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
779     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
780     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
781     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
782     *      {@code maxLength}.
783     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
784     *      the empty String.
785     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
786     *      {@code null}.
787     *
788     *  @since 0.0.5
789     */
790    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
791    public static final String checkTextLen( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
792    {
793        if( requireNotEmptyArgument( text, requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ).length() > maxLength )
794        {
795            throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
796        }
797
798        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
799        return text.toString();
800    }   //  checkTextLen()
801
802    /**
803     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
804     *  different from
805     *  {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)},
806     *  it may be {@code null} or empty.
807     *
808     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
809     *      will be thrown.
810     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
811     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
812     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String, {@code null}
813     *      if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the argument fails any of the
814     *      tests, an
815     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
816     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
817     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
818     *      {@code maxLength}.
819     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is empty.
820     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
821     *
822     *  @since 0.0.5
823     */
824    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
825    public static final String checkTextLenNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException
826    {
827        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
828
829        String retValue = null;
830        if( nonNull( text ) )
831        {
832            if( text.length() > maxLength )
833            {
834                throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
835            }
836            retValue = text.toString();
837        }
838
839        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
840        return retValue;
841    }   //  checkTextLenNull()
842
843    /**
844     *  Changes the first letter of the given String tolower case as per
845     *  {@link Character#toLowerCase(char)}.
846     *  No other letters are changed. A {@code null} input String returns
847     *  {@code null}.<br>
848     *  <br>Samples:<pre><code>  StringUtils.decapitalize( null ) = null;
849     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;&quot;)     = &quot;&quot;;
850     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;Cat&quot;)  = &quot;cat&quot;;
851     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;CAT&quot;)  = &quot;cAT&quot;;</code></pre>
852     *  <br>Basically, this is the complementary method to
853     *  {@link #capitalize(CharSequence)}.
854     *  Use this method to normalise the name of bean attributes.
855     *
856     *  @param  input   The String to <i>decapitalise</i>, may be {@code null}.
857     *  @return The <i>decapitalised</i> String, {@code null} if the argument
858     *      was {@code null}.
859     *  @see #capitalize(CharSequence)
860     *
861     *  @since 0.0.5
862     */
863    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
864    public static final String decapitalize( final CharSequence input )
865    {
866        String retValue = null;
867
868        if( nonNull( input ) )
869        {
870            retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
871            if( isNotEmpty( input ) )
872            {
873                final var str = input.toString();
874                retValue = (toLowerCase( str.charAt( 0 ) ) + str.substring( 1 )).intern();
875            }
876        }
877
878        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
879        return retValue;
880    }   //  decapitalize()
881
882    /**
883     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a
884     *  {@code String} so that the result can be used in the context of HTML.}
885     *  Wherever possible, the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5
886     *  entity; only when there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode
887     *  escape.</p>
888     *  <p>So if you call the method with the argument
889     *  &quot;<i>S&uuml;&szlig;e</i>&quot;, it will return
890     *  &quot;<code>S&amp;uuml;&amp;szlig;e</code>&quot;.</p>
891     *  <p>If the input will be, for example, a Chinese text like this:
892     *  &quot;<i>çä½</i>&quot; (means "Ball"), you may get back something like
893     *  this: &quot;<code>&amp;#x7403;&amp;#x4F53;</code>&quot;, as there are
894     *  no entities defined for (any) Chinese letters.</p>
895     *  <p>The method supports all known HTML&nbsp;5.0 entities, including
896     *  funky accents. But it will not escape several commonly used characters
897     *  like the full stop ('.'), the comma (','), the colon (':'), or the
898     *  semicolon (';'), although they will be handled properly by
899     *  {@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)}.</p>
900     *  <p>Note that the commonly used apostrophe escape character
901     *  (&amp;apos;) that was not a legal entity for HTML before HTML&nbsp;5 is
902     *  now supported.</p>
903     *
904     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
905     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
906     *      argument was already {@code null}.
907     *
908     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
909     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
910     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
911     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
912     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
913     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
914     *
915     *  @since 0.0.5
916     */
917    /*
918     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
919     *  and &#x4F53; (for 'ç' and 'ä½'), therefore it was required to add the
920     *  Chinese characters directly into the comment above.
921     */
922    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
923    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence input )
924    {
925        final var retValue = nonNull( input ) ? HTML50.escape( input ) : null;
926
927        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
928        return retValue;
929    }   //  escapeHTML()
930
931    /**
932     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
933     *  writes them to an
934     *  {@link Appendable}.
935     *  For details, refer to
936     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
937     *
938     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
939     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
940     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
941     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
942     *      from calls to the
943     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
944     *      method.
945     *
946     *  @see #escapeHTML(CharSequence)
947     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
948     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
949     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
950     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
951     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
952     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
953     *
954     *  @since 0.0.5
955     */
956    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
957    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence input ) throws IOException
958    {
959        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
960
961        if( nonNull( input ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, input );
962    }   //  escapeHTML()
963
964    /**
965     *  Formats the given {@code String} for the output into JSONText. This
966     *  means that the input sequence will be surrounded by double quotes, and
967     *  backslash sequences are put into all the right places.<br>
968     *  <br>&lt; and &gt; will be inserted as their Unicode values, allowing
969     *  JSON text to be delivered in HTML.<br>
970     *  <br>In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an
971     *  unescaped quote or backslash, so these are translated to Unicode
972     *  escapes also.
973     *
974     *  @param  input   The string to escape to the JSON format; it may be
975     *      empty, but not {@code null}.
976     *  @return A string correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
977     *
978     *  @since 0.0.5
979     */
980    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
981    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
982    public static final String escapeJSON( final CharSequence input )
983    {
984        var retValue = "\"\""; // The JSON empty string.
985        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" ).length();
986        if( len > 0 )
987        {
988            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( len * 2 ).append( '"' );
989            @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
990            char c;
991            for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
992            {
993                c = input.charAt( i );
994                switch( c )
995                {
996                    case '\\', '"', '<', '>', '&' -> buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
997
998                    case '\b' -> buffer.append( "\\b" );
999
1000                    case '\t' -> buffer.append( "\\t" );
1001
1002                    case '\n'-> buffer.append( "\\n" );
1003
1004                    case '\f' -> buffer.append( "\\f" );
1005
1006                    case '\r' -> buffer.append( "\\r" );
1007
1008                    default ->
1009                    {
1010                        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression,CharacterComparison,UnnecessaryUnicodeEscape
1011                        if( (c < ' ')
1012                            || ((c >= '\u0080') && (c < '\u00a0'))
1013                            || ((c >= '\u2000') && (c < '\u2100')) )
1014                        {
1015                            buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1016                        }
1017                        else
1018                        {
1019                            buffer.append( c );
1020                        }
1021                    }
1022                }
1023            }
1024            buffer.append( '"' );
1025            retValue = buffer.toString();
1026        }
1027
1028        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1029        return retValue;
1030    }   //  escapeJSON()
1031
1032    /**
1033     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes and writes them to a
1034     *  {@link Appendable}.
1035     *
1036     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1037     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1038     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1039     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1040     *      from calls to the
1041     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1042     *      method.
1043     *
1044     *  @since 0.0.5
1045     */
1046    @SuppressWarnings( "SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches" )
1047    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1048    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final char c ) throws IOException
1049    {
1050        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1051
1052        TestSwitch: switch( c )
1053        {
1054            case '\\' -> appendable.append( "\\" );
1055            case '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')', '^', '$', '&', '*', '.', '+', '|', '?' -> appendable.append( "\\" ).append( c );
1056            case '\t' -> appendable.append( "\\t" );
1057            case '\n' -> appendable.append( "\\n" );
1058            case '\r' -> appendable.append( "\\r" );
1059            case '\f' -> appendable.append( "\\f" );
1060            case '\u0007' -> appendable.append( "\\a" );
1061            case '\u001B' -> appendable.append( "\\e" ); // ESC
1062            default -> appendable.append( c );
1063        }   //  TestSwitch:
1064    }   //  escapeRegex()
1065
1066    /**
1067     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes.
1068     *
1069     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1070     *  @return A {@code String} with the escaped character.
1071     *
1072     *  @since 0.0.5
1073     */
1074    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1075    public static final String escapeRegex( final char c )
1076    {
1077        final var retValue = new StringBuilder();
1078        try
1079        {
1080            escapeRegex( retValue, c );
1081        }
1082        catch( final IOException e )
1083        {
1084            /*
1085             * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1086             * not define an IOException.
1087             */
1088            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1089        }
1090
1091        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1092        return retValue.toString();
1093    }   //  escapeRegex()
1094
1095    /**
1096     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes.
1097     *
1098     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1099     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the argument
1100     *      was already {@code null}.
1101     *
1102     *  @since 0.0.5
1103     */
1104    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1105    public static final String escapeRegex( final CharSequence input )
1106    {
1107        String retValue = null;
1108        if( nonNull( input ) )
1109        {
1110            final var len = input.length();
1111            if( len > 0 )
1112            {
1113                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
1114                try
1115                {
1116                    escapeRegex( buffer, input );
1117                }
1118                catch( final IOException e )
1119                {
1120                    /*
1121                     * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1122                     * not define an IOException.
1123                     */
1124                    throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1125                }
1126                retValue = buffer.toString();
1127            }
1128            else
1129            {
1130                retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
1131            }
1132        }
1133
1134        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1135        return retValue;
1136    }   //  escapeRegex()
1137
1138    /**
1139     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes and
1140     *  writes them to a
1141     *  {@link Appendable}.
1142     *
1143     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1144     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape. If {@code null} or the empty
1145     *      String, nothing will be put to the appendable.
1146     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1147     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1148     *      from calls to the
1149     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1150     *      method.
1151     *
1152     *  @since 0.0.5
1153     */
1154    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1155    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence input ) throws IOException
1156    {
1157        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1158
1159        if( isNotEmpty( input ) )
1160        {
1161            ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < input.length(); ++i )
1162            {
1163                escapeRegex( appendable, input.charAt( i ) );
1164            }   //  ScanLoop:
1165        }
1166    }   //  escapeRegex()
1167
1168    /**
1169     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1170     *  entities.}</p>
1171     *  <p>For example:</p>
1172     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1173     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1174     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1175     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1176     *
1177     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
1178     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1179     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1180     *
1181     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1182     */
1183    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1184    public static final String escapeXML( final CharSequence input )
1185    {
1186        final var retValue = nonNull( input ) ? XML.escape( input ) : null;
1187
1188        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1189        return retValue;
1190    }   //  escapeXML()
1191
1192    /**
1193     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1194     *  entities and writes them to an
1195     *  {@link Appendable}.}</p>
1196     *  <p>For example:</p>
1197     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1198     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1199     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1200     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1201     *
1202     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1203     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1204     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1205     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1206     *      from calls to the
1207     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1208     *      method.
1209     *
1210     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1211     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1212     *
1213     *  @since 0.0.5
1214     */
1215    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1216    public static final void escapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence input ) throws IOException
1217    {
1218        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1219
1220        if( nonNull( input ) ) XML.escape( appendable, input );
1221    }   //  escapeXML()

1225     *
1226     *  @param  input   The String to test.
1227     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is
1228     *      {@code null} or the empty String.
1229     *
1230     *  @since 0.0.5
1231     */
1232    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1233    public static final boolean isEmpty( final CharSequence input ) { return isNull( input ) || input.isEmpty(); }

1235    /**

1240     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is not

1244     *
1245     *  @since 0.0.5
1246     */
1247    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1248    public static final boolean isEmptyOrBlank( final CharSequence input )
1249    {
1250        final var retValue = isNull( input ) || input.toString().isBlank();
1251
1252        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1253        return retValue;
1254    }   //  isEmptyOrBlank()

1264     *  @since 0.0.5

1266    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )

1286
1287        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1288        return retValue;
1289    }   //  isNotEmptyOrBlank()

1291    /**
1292     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
1293     *  {@link Stream}.
1294     *
1295     *  @param  stream  The strings.
1296     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1297     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
1298     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1299     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
1300     *
1301     *  @since 0.0.5
1302     */
1303    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1304    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
1305    {
1306        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
1307            .mapToInt( string -> nonNull( string ) ? string.length() : -1 )
1308            .max()
1309            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
1310
1311        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1312        return retValue;
1313    }   //  maxContentLength()
1314
1315    /**
1316     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1317     *  {@link Collection}.
1318     *
1319     *  @param  list    The strings.
1320     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1321     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
1322     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1323     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
1324     *
1325     *  @since 0.0.5
1326     */
1327    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1328    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
1329    {
1330        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
1331
1332        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1333        return retValue;
1334    }   //  maxContentLength()
1335
1336    /**
1337     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1338     *  array.
1339     *
1340     *  @param  a   The strings.
1341     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1342     *      in the array are {@code null}, and
1343     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1344     *      if the given array has zero length.
1345     *
1346     *  @since 0.0.5
1347     */
1348    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1349    public static final int maxContentLength( final CharSequence... a )
1350    {
1351        final var retValue = maxContentLength( Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( a, "a" ) ) );
1352
1353        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1354        return retValue;
1355    }   //  maxContentLength()
1356
1357    /**
1358     *  <p>{@summary Normalizes the given String to a pure ASCII String.} This
1359     *  replaces 'Ã' by 'ss' and replaces all diacritical characters by their
1360     *  base form (that mean that 'Ã¼' gets 'u' and so on). For the normalizing
1361     *  of a search criteria, this should be sufficient, although it may cause
1362     *  issues for non-latin scripts, as for these the input can be mapped to
1363     *  the empty String.
1364     *
1365     *  @note   The scandinavian letters 'Ã¸' and 'Ã' are not diacritical
1366     *      letters, nevertheless they will be replaced.
1367     *
1368     *  @param  input   The input string.
1369     *  @return The normalised String, only containing ASCII characters; it
1370     *      could be empty.
1371     *
1372     *  TODO Check the implementation and the results!! 2022-12-10
1373     */
1374    public static final String normalizeToASCII( final CharSequence input )
1375    {
1376        final var str = requireNonNullArgument( input, "s" ).toString()
1377            .replace( "Ã", "ss" )
1378            .replace( 'Ã¸', 'o' )
1379            .replace( 'Ã', 'O' );
1380        final var retValue = normalize( str, NFD )
1381            .replaceAll( "[^\\p{ASCII}]", EMPTY_STRING );
1382
1383        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1384        return retValue;
1385    }   //  normalizeToASCII()
1386
1387    /**
1388     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1389     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1390     *
1391     *  @param  input   The string to format.
1392     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1393     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1394     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1395     *  @param  mode    The
1396     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1397     *  @param  clip    {@code true} if the input string should be cut in case
1398     *      it is longer than {@code length}, {@code false} if it has to be
1399     *      returned unchanged .
1400     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1401     *
1402     *  @since 0.0.5
1403     */
1404    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1405    public static final String pad( final CharSequence input, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final boolean clip )
1406    {
1407        return pad( input, length, c, mode, clip ? CLIPPING_CUT : CLIPPING_NONE );
1408    }   //  pad()
1409
1410    /**
1411     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1412     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1413     *
1414     *  @param  input   The string to format.
1415     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1416     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1417     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1418     *  @param  mode    The
1419     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1420     *  @param  clip    The
1421     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Clipping clipping mode}.
1422     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1423     *
1424     *  @since 0.0.5
1425     */
1426    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1427    public static final String pad( final CharSequence input, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final Clipping clip )
1428    {
1429        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1430        if( ((requireNonNullArgument( clip, "clip" ) == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE) && (length < 4)) || ((clip == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE) && (length < 5)) )
1431        {
1432            throw new ValidationException( "Length %d is too short for clipping mode %s".formatted( length, clip.toString() ) );
1433        }
1434        requireNonNullArgument( mode, "mode" );
1435
1436        final String retValue;
1437        final var currentLength = requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" ).length();
1438
1439        if( (length > 0) && (length != currentLength) )
1440        {
1441            if( currentLength > length )
1442            {
1443                retValue = clip.clip( input, length );
1444            }
1445            else
1446            {
1447                final var padSize = length - currentLength;
1448                retValue = mode.pad( input, padSize, c );
1449            }
1450        }
1451        else
1452        {
1453            retValue = input.toString();
1454        }
1455
1456        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1457        return retValue;
1458    }   //  pad()
1459
1460    /**
1461     *  <p>{@summary Fills up the given string to the given length by adding
1462     *  blanks on both sides; will abbreviate the string if it is longer than
1463     *  the given length.} The minimum length is 5.</p>
1464     *  <p>This is a shortcut to a call to
1465     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ) }.</p>
1466     *
1467     *  @param  input   The string to format.
1468     *  @param  length  The desired length; minimum value is 5.
1469     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1470     *
1471     *  @see Padding#PADDING_CENTER
1472     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
1473     *
1474     *  @since 0.0.5
1475     */
1476    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1477    public static final String padCenter( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ); }
1478
1479    /**
1480     *  <p>{@summary Fills up the given string to the given length by adding
1481     *  blanks on the left side;  will abbreviate the string if it is longer
1482     *  than the given length.} The minimum length is 4.</p>
1483     *  <p>This is a shortcut to a call to
1484     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_LEFT, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE ) }.</p>
1485     *
1486     *  @param  input   The string to format.
1487     *  @param  length  The desired length; the minimum value is 4.
1488     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1489     *
1490     *  @see Padding#PADDING_LEFT
1491     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
1492     *
1493     *  @since 0.0.5
1494     */
1495    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1496    public static final String padLeft( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_LEFT, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE ); }

1498    /**
1499     *  <p>{@summary Fills up the given string to the given length by adding
1500     *  blanks on the right side; will abbreviate the string if it is longer
1501     *  than the given length.} The minimum length is 4.</p>
1502     *  <p>This is a shortcut to a call to
1503     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_RIGHT, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE ) }.</p>
1504     *

1506     *  @param  length  The desired length; the minimum value is 4.

1515    public static final String padRight( final CharSequence input, final int length ) { return pad( input, length, ' ', PADDING_RIGHT, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE ); }
